author: Special Correspondent
text:
Of the 11 members, M. Rajaram is a former IAS officer

A total of 11 persons, including a former IAS officer, were appointed as members of Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission (TNPSC) by Governor K. Rosaiah on Sunday.

According to an official notification, the new members are R. Pratapkumar, V. Subbaiah, S. Muthuraj, M. Sethuraaman, A.V. Balusamy, M. Madasamy, V. Ramamurthy, P. Krishnakumar, A. Subramanian, N.B. Punniamoorthi and M. Rajaram.

These new members would hold the post for six years or till they attain 62 years of age, the notification stated.

Of the 11 members, M. Rajaram is a former IAS officer, seven others hold legal degrees, two have engineering degrees and another holds a diploma in civil engineering. Two members hold doctorates.

Rercuitment plan report

According to the latest recruitment plan report, TNPSC is expected to conduct exams to fill about 10,026 posts notified by the government for 2016-2017, including 4,513 posts for which exams were not conducted last year due to rains and floods.

In the first week of February, notifications for filling up 4,931 vacancies are expected to be issued.

These new members would hold the post for six years or till they attain 62 years

of age
title: New members appointed to TNPSC
